boardgame.name: Drachenhort
Drageborgen
Drakborgen
DungeonQuest
Skatten i borgen
boardgame.description: Players explore the ruins of Castle Dragonfire trying to reach the treasure chamber in the center of the dungeon and escape alive with as much treasure as possible. A limited number of turns before the game ends puts pressure on players to take risks and score rewards because anyone left in the dungeon when time runs out dies! A tile-laying system creates the maze-like dungeon and ensures that no two games are ever exactly the same._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Originally published as Drakborgen (Dragon's Keep) in 1985 by Alga, a subsidiary of BRIO AB. Sold in Norway (Skatten i borgen) and Denmark (Drageborgen). Licenced to Germany (Schmidt Spiele) as Drachenhort, to Great Britain (Games Workshop) as DungeonQuest. A 2nd edition named Drakborgen Legenden was released in 2002 (never released outside Sweden). The game was re-licensed to FFG in 2010, who released the 3rd edition the same year. See the family entry for more information._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Expanded by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Drakborgen II (the Swedish expansion that upon Games Workshop's British release was split into the two below:)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Heroes for Dungeonquest_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Dungeonquest: Catacombs_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implemented by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Drakborgen Legenden_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; DungeonQuest (third edition)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; DungeonQuest Revised Edition_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

*Includes the Heroes for DungeonQuest expansion as well as DungeonQuest* This is for a playable but clearly flawed copy of DungeonQuest and its Heroes expansion. Here_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the bad news: *No figures, for either the base game or for the expansion, are included.* In addition, 3 of the 115 room tiles are missing, and 1 of the 8 dragon tiles (sleeping) is gone. Some of the included room tiles were printed a bit off center. Similarly, some of the treasure counters were off center. Those have their values written on their backs, so their amount will be legible. And instead of the original rulebook from Heroes for Dungeonquest, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m including a copy. (Yes, these are the reasons the price is low.) It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s playable with the missing tiles, but I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll include a disk of good scans of the missing tiles as well as well centered versions of the off-centered tiles, if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re feeling ambitious. (They were done by the person I got the game from, who had an extra copy.) Okay, now on to more standard wear: The board pieces are clean and in good to very good condition. The many cards (room, search, crypt, corpse, door, monster, trap, ring, spell, and sundry others) are all clean and in good condition. The hero cards are in fair to good condition -- They_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re completely clean, but a few of them (Volrik, Ulv, Sir Rohan, and Rildo) have slightly bent corners. Even the combat cards are in fair to good condition -- They show light dirt and wear on the edges. The counters (ring, dragon, treasure, combat) and tiles are also clean and in good condition, except for the missing and off center counters mentioned, above. The main game rulebook and reference sheet are in very good condition. As mentioned above, the Heroes rulebook is a photocopy. The dice and various counters (except the miniatures!) are all present. The box bottom shows very heavy wear, especially at the corners and edges. There are small breaks in the paper on two of the corners, and a ~2 inch long paper split along one edge. The box top shows heavy wear -- Wear is very heavy at the bottom corners and moderate to heavy on the edges. The front picture shows moderate wear. One corner of the box top was apparently split at some point, but was neatly reglued. Okay, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m done describing, now. Please contact me if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d like anything clarified or photographed! The shipping charge will be an estimate of the actual cost of shipping the game to you. That means I can usually reduce shipping charges if you buy more than one of my games -- Send me a message and I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll calculate the discount.
